title: Verify: Selecting WWE Network Channel successfully opens WWE Network
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has setup their Xbox device
AND has gone to the "Xbox Live"
AND has added the "WWE Network" Channel
custom_steps: WHEN the user selects the "WWE Network" Channel from the Xbox menu
custom_expected: THEN the "WWE Network" will open successfully

title: Verify: User will receive an access gate when launching a video before logging in
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has setup their Xbox device
AND the Xbox device is currently connected to an Internet connection
AND the "WWE Network" channel is installed
AND we have already logged into the WWE Network with an account
AND we select a video
custom_steps: WHEN we access the WWE Network channel from the main Xbox screen
custom_expected:
THEN the access gate will not be encountered
AND the user will be brought to the Home screen

title: Verify: WWE Network can be accessed while the Xbox is connected wirelessly
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has setup their Xbox device
AND the Xbox device is currently connected to a wireless network
AND the "WWE Network" channel is installed
custom_steps: WHEN the user selects the "WWE Network" Channel from the Xbox menu
custom_expected: THEN the "WWE Network" will open successfully

title: Verify: WWE can be accessed while the Xbox is connected using a wired connection
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has setup their Xbox device
AND the Xbox device is currently connected to a wired network connection
AND the "WWE Network" channel is installed
custom_steps: WHEN the user selects the "WWE Network" Channel from the Xbox menu
custom_expected: THEN the "WWE Network" will open successfully

title: Login: Verify Login message opens
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed the WWE Network channel
AND we have not previously logged into an account in the channel
custom_steps:
WHEN we access the WWE Network
AND select the Sign In menu option
custom_expected:
THEN we will be presented with a Login screen
AND an Email Address field will be present
AND a password field will be present
AND a CONTINUE button will display underneath

title: Login: Verify Login success
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed the WWE Network channel
AND we have not previously logged into an account
custom_steps:
WHEN we access the WWE Network channel
AND select the Sign In menu option
AND we enter valid WWE credentials
custom_expected:
THEN the credentials will be accepted 
AND we will brought to the WWE Network Home Screen

title: Login: Verify Login failed
refs: FInd out if error message will include Forget Password info
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed the WWE Network channel
AND we have not previously logged into an account in the channel
custom_steps:
WHEN we access the WWE Network channel
AND select the Sign In menu option
AND we enter invalid WWE credentials
custom_expected:
THEN a Login Error message will appear
AND the message states 'Please enter a correct username and/or password'
AND all formatting and text will be readable

title: Login: Verify text and formatting are clear and readable
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed the WWE Network Channel
AND we are on the Login Screen
custom_steps:
WHEN we look at the Text
AND we look at the buttons
custom_expected:
THEN we will see that the text is spelled correctly on the page
AND each label is formatted correctly

title: Login: Verify pressing the Back button from the Login Error returns user Home
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed the WWE Network Channel
AND select the Sign In menu option
AND we have entered Invalid credentials at the Login Screen
custom_steps:
WHEN the Login Error occurs
AND we select the Close button [B]
custom_expected: THEN we will be brought back to the Home Screen

title: Login: Pressing the Back button from the Login Screen returns the user Home
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed the WWE Network channel
AND select the Sign In menu option
AND we are on the Login Screen
custom_steps: WHEN we press the Back [B] button
custom_expected:
THEN we will exit the Sign In page
AND we will be returned to the Home page

title: Home: Verify when the WWE Network Channel is accessed the user lands on the Home screen
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user has installed the WWE Network
custom_steps: WHEN the WWE Network Channel is accessed
custom_expected: THEN the user will be brought to the Home Screen

title: Home: Verify text and formatting are clear and readable
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed the WWE Channel
AND we access the Channel
custom_steps: WHEN we traverse the Home Screen options
custom_expected:
THEN all text will be formatted correctly
AND all thumbnails will appear without issue

AND we have accessed the channel
custom_steps: WHEN we navigate to the Home Screen
custom_expected:

AND this will display as a large Promotional Image

AND we have accessed the Channel

AND look at Large Promo image for the Live Broadcast
custom_expected:

AND the Show's title will be displayed
AND the Air Date will be displayed
AND all text will be formatted correctly

AND we have accessed the Channel
custom_steps:
WHEN we are on the Home Screen
AND the Live Broadcast changes
custom_expected:
THEN the Menu will refresh based on EPG schedule
AND the On Now display will update accordingly

AND we are NOT signed into an account
AND we are on the Home screen

'Continue Watching' and "Watchlist' tiles DO NOT appear 
Two other promo assets display instead (4-tile grid display)

title: Home: Verify 'Continue Watching' and "Watchlist' thumbnails DO NOT display on Home Screen - Logged In

AND we have accessed the Channel
AND we are signed into a valid account
AND no shows are added to the Watchlist
AND no shows have been partially watched
AND we are on the Home screen

custom_expected:
'Continue Watching' and "Watchlist' tiles DO NOT appear

title: Verify text and formatting are clear and readable
custom_preconds: Continue Watching and Watchlist items must be added to user's test account.
custom_steps: Confirm the text is readable and formatted correctly within the tiles (bottom two)
custom_expected: Text font, size and formatting should be consistent and fit within the designed space. (bottom two tiles to the right of the ON NOW tile)

title: Verify ON NOW/Linear presentation of VOD program is not bookmarked
custom_preconds: ON NOW program should not already be in the current user test account's Watchlist or Continue Watching list.
custom_steps:
1. Note ON NOW program.
2. Launch ON NOW > NOW
3. Let play for 10+ seconds.
4. Exit via BACK.
custom_expected:
Current program should not appear in:

1. HOME carousel Watchlist/Continue Watching
1. MY ACCOUNT Watchlist/Continue Watching

title: Verify ON NOW/Watch From Beginning presentation of VOD program is bookmarked
custom_preconds: ON NOW program should not already be in the current user test account's Watchlist or Continue Watching list.
custom_steps:
1. Note ON NOW program.
2. Launch ON NOW > FROM BEGINNING
3. Let play for 10+ seconds.
4. Exit via BACK.
custom_expected:
Current program should appear in:

HOME carousel Watchlist/Continue Watching
MY ACCOUNT Watchlist/Continue Watching

[Note: Improvements logged in JIRA to address limits of ON NOW/From Beginning launch when bookmarked program is currently playing]

title: Verify Linear Live/Ghost programs are not bookmarked
custom_preconds:
ON NOW program should not already be in the current user test account's Watchlist or Continue Watching list.
ON NOW program should be confirmed a Live event and that From Beginning will launch Ghost version.

(To find a live event, see http://network.wwe.com/schedule and look for videos tagged "NEW")
custom_steps:
1. Note ON NOW program.
2. Launch ON NOW > FROM BEGINNING
3. Let play for 10+ seconds.
4. Exit via BACK.
custom_expected:
Current program should not appear in:

1. HOME carousel Watchlist/Continue Watching
1. MY ACCOUNT Watchlist/Continue Watching

title: Verify enabling parental controls will hide (yet preserve) restricted content from user’s Continue Watching list in Home Carousel
custom_preconds: Test account should be set with parental controls OFF and ONLY ONE TV-14 or higher rated item in Continue Watching.
custom_steps:
1. Confirm TV-14 or higher item appear in Continue Watching carousel thumb.
2. Quit app.
3. Through user account (via WWE Network site) change account to "Parental Controls ON" and save settings.
4. Relaunch XB1.
5. Confirm TV-14 or higher Continue Watching carousel item does not appear.
6. Quit app.
7. Through user account (via WWE Network site) change account to "Parental Controls OFF" and save settings.
8. Relaunch XB1.
9. Confirm TV-14 or higher Continue Watching carousel item appears as expected as seen in step 1.
custom_expected: Enabling parental controls will hide restricted content from user’s Continue Watching on Home Carousel and disabling enabling parental controls will reveal the same content.

title: Verify enabling parental controls will hide (yet preserve) restricted content from user’s Watchlist in Home Carousel
custom_preconds: Test account should be set with parental controls OFF and ONLY ONE TV-14 or higher rated item in Watchlist.
custom_steps:
1. Confirm TV-14 or higher item appears in Watchlist carousel thumb.
2. Quit app.
3. Through user account (via WWE Network site) change account to "Parental Controls ON" and save settings.
4. Relaunch XB1.
5. Confirm TV-14 or higher Watchlist carousel item does not appear.
6. Quit app.
7. Through user account (via WWE Network site) change account to "Parental Controls OFF" and save settings.
8. Relaunch XB1.
9. Confirm TV-14 or higher Watchlist carousel item appears as expected as seen in step 1.
custom_expected: Enabling parental controls will hide restricted content from user’s Watchlist on Home Carousel and disabling enabling parental controls will reveal the same content.

title: Verify empty Watchlists and Continue Watching lists DO NOT display in Home Carousel if no items have been added
custom_preconds:
User must be signed in
User must have one partially watched videos on the account
User must have one asset added to the watchlist on the account
custom_steps:
Observe the Home screen and verify that there are Watchlist and Continue Watching tiles
Under the My Account menu, access the Watchlist item and remove it
Under the My Account menu, access the Continue Watching list and FFWD then let play out
(OR you can remove assets from both sections using the web browser experience)
Then access the Home screen again (you may need to quit the app first, then relaunch)
custom_expected:
The Watchlist and Continue Watching tiles do not appear
In their place are a couple of other random 'Featured' shows

title: Verify populated Watchlists and Continue Watching lists are shown in Home Carousel
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed the WWE Network
AND we have accessed the Channel
AND we are signed into a valid account
AND we have at least one show/series added to the Watchlist
AND we have at least one show partially watched
AND we are on the Home screen
custom_steps: WHEN we observe the UI
custom_expected: 'Continue Watching' and "Watchlist' tiles will appear with the most recently added show's thumbnail displaying

title: Continue Watching: Verify launching a VOD and exiting playback before the end; 'Continue Watching' thumbnail displays on Home
custom_preconds:
No Items have been added to the CONTINUE WATCHING list
We have confirmed on the Home page that no Continue Watching thumbnail is displayed
custom_steps:
1. Select any VOD from within the Shows
2. At show launch select Watch Now
3. Let playback continue for at least 15 seconds
4. Note the show and progress
5. Back out of video
6. Go to HOME
custom_expected:
![](index.php?/attachments/get/916)

CONTINUE WATCHING tile displays to the right of the ON NOW tile along the lower half of the four thumbnail grid

title: Episode: Verify accessing an episode from the Show Page opens the Episode Show Launch Page
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed the WWE Network
AND we have accessed the Channel
AND we have navigated to the Shows Submenu
custom_steps:
WHEN we have navigated to a random Show Page
AND we select a random episode
custom_expected:
THEN we will be brought to the Episode Page
AND the Show's title will appear as the Submenu Title
AND a larger version of the thumbnail will display
AND the show's metadata will be present

title: Episode: Very show metadata appears accurately and is formatted correctly
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed the WWE Network
AND we have accessed the Channel
AND we have navigated to a Show Page
AND we have accessed an Episode Page
custom_steps:
WHEN we look to the right of the promo image
AND we look at the episode's metadata
custom_expected:
THEN the episode's metadata will appear correctly
AND the data will be formatted properly
AND the data that appears should be the following:
> Show Title
> MM/DD/YY (Air Date if applicable)
> Episode Title (if applicable)
> Episode Description
> Rating (Ex: TV-PG)

title: Episode: Verify selecting PLAY launches full screen playback successfully
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed the WWE Network
AND we have accessed the Channel
AND we navigate to a Show Page
custom_steps:
WHEN we locate an episode with available media
AND we navigate to the episode page
AND we attempt to play this
custom_expected:
THEN the episode will begin to play
AND the playback will be full screen

title: Schedule: Verify the Schedule header highlights
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed the WWE Network
AND we have accessed the Channel
custom_steps: WHEN we navigate to the Schedule menu header
custom_expected:
THEN the menu header will show a white border around the white SCHEDULE menu text
AND selecting the menu option will show a white border around a now red SCHEDULE menu text

title: Schedule: Verify selecting Schedule opens the Schedule Page
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed the WWE Network
AND we have accessed the Channel
custom_steps: WHEN we navigate to and select the Schedule menu option
custom_expected: THEN the section contents update to the Schedule user interface

title: Schedule: Verify that the Schedule displays two navigation options
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed the WWE Network
AND we have accessed the Channel
custom_steps: WHEN we access the Schedule Section
custom_expected:
THEN the user will see two schedule options

> Today
> Tomorrow

title: Schedule: Verify Play button overlay displays over graphic
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed the WWE Network
AND we have accessed the Channel
AND we are on the Schedule Screen
custom_steps: WHEN we look at the Large Promo tile for the Live/On Now Program
custom_expected: THEN the Play button overlay graphic will be present

title: Schedule: Verify Play button overlay default and hover state
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed the WWE Network
AND we have accessed the Channel
AND we are on the Schedule Screen
custom_steps: WHEN toggling focus On and Off of the On Now asset
custom_expected:
THEN the default color is a white Play button on a black background
AND the hover state color is a white Play button on a red background

title: Schedule: Verify date sub-header is accurately labeled and updates accordingly
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed the WWE Network
AND we have accessed the Channel
custom_steps:
WHEN we navigate to the Schedule Section
AND we view the schedule for any date
custom_expected:
THEN the Submenu header (below the Today and Tomorrow options) will display the day of the week and the date

Exception: "Today's Schedule" will NOT show a date (but all days thereafter should)

title: Schedule: Verify metadata displays properly and is formatted correctly
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed the WWE Network
AND we have accessed the Channel
AND we have navigated to the Schedule section
custom_steps:
WHEN a date is displayed
AND we traverse through the scheduled content
custom_expected:
THEN all shows images will display correctly
AND the metadata will be formatted properly

title: Schedule: Verify changing Time Zones displays properly (US Only - West vs East)
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed the WWE Network
AND we have accessed the Channel
AND we have navigated to the Schedule section
custom_steps:
WHEN we navigate to the Schedule menu
AND we notate the asset time that is On Now
THEN we quit the app 
AND change the time zone from within the device Settings > All Settings > System > Time > Time Zone 
THEN we exit Settings and relaunch the app, navigate to the Schedule and notate the asset time that is On Now

(UTC-08:00 Pacific Time to UTC-05:00 Eastern Time and vice versa)
custom_expected:
THEN the On Now asset will reflect the selected zone's current time appropriately (+/- 3 hours depending on timezone)
AND the timezone labeling will change from PDT/PST to EDT/EST (depending on which zone and whether Standard or Daylight time)

title: Schedule: Verify that pressing the play button (Watch Now) launches the video playback
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed the WWE Network
AND we have accessed the Channel
AND we are signed in with a valid WWE account
AND we navigate to Today's Schedule
custom_steps:
WHEN we select the Play option for the On Now asset
AND the Watch Now button is selected
custom_expected:
THEN the episode will begin to play from the current 'Live' position
AND no pre-rolls will occur

title: Schedule: Verify that pressing the play button (Watch from Beginning) launches the video playback
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed the WWE Network
AND we have accessed the Channel
AND we are signed in with a valid WWE account
AND we navigate to Today's Schedule
custom_steps:
WHEN we select the Play option for the On Now asset
AND the Watch from Beginning button is selected
custom_expected:
THEN the episode will begin to play from the beginning of the program
AND pre-rolls will occur:  Info regarding watching the video and TV rating

title: Schedule: Verify programs display in chronological order for the selected day
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed the WWE Network
AND we have accessed the Channel
AND we have navigated to any day's schedule
custom_steps: WHEN we view the scheduled programming
custom_expected:
THEN the day's schedule will begin at 12:00 AM
AND the schedule will display in chronological order

(NOTE: If the day does NOT begin at 12:00 AM, verify the end of the previous day's asset's runtime and calculate accordingly)

(You may also see EPG data: http://epg.media.net.wwe.com/prod/epg_large2.json)

title: Today: Verify navigation control works in both directions
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed the WWE Network
AND we have accessed the Channel
AND we navigate to Today's schedule
custom_steps:
WHEN we move the cursor to the day's programming
AND we scroll Down
AND we scroll Up
custom_expected:
THEN we will be able to navigate in both directions
AND we will be able to view the entire day's worth of content

NOTE: The "entire day's worth of content" begins at the current time (no archives) and continues through the end of the day

title: Today: Verify Today's schedule properly reflects the current day's programming
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed the WWE Network
AND we have accessed the Channel
custom_steps: WHEN we navigate to the Today Schedule
custom_expected:
THEN the Today schedule will accurately display the programming schedule for today's content

NOTE:  Today's schedule begins with the most recent, active 'On Now' asset (the day's archives are not displayed)

(EPG data here: http://epg.media.net.wwe.com/prod/epg_large2.json)

title: Today: Verify the LIVE broadcast is labeled as "On Now"
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed the WWE Network
AND we have accessed the Channel
AND we navigated to the Schedule section
custom_steps:
WHEN we view the Today Schedule
AND we look at the day's content
custom_expected:
THEN the content in the current time block will be listed as ON NOW
AND the episode will be available to view

title: Today: Verify schedule flips at 12:00 AM
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed the WWE Network
AND we have accessed the Channel
AND we have navigated to the Schedule section
AND the time is before 12 AM EST
custom_steps:
WHEN the time hits 12:00 AM

( You may fake the system time to a time just before 12 AM and allow to change.  A good reference to use is: http://www.timeanddate.com/worldclock/ )
custom_expected: THEN the "Today Schedule" will accurately reflect the new calendar day

title: Today: Verify carousel position focuses on LIVE broadcast when Today schedule is accessed
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed the WWE Network
AND we have accessed the Channel
AND we navigated to the Schedule section
custom_steps: WHEN we navigate down into the Today Schedule
custom_expected: THEN the first position will default to the live 'On Now' broadcast

title: Today: Verify selecting Today jumps to today's schedule
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed the WWE Network
AND we have accessed the Channel
AND we navigated to the Schedule Section
custom_steps:
WHEN we select the Tomorrow schedule option
THEN we select the Today Schedule option
custom_expected:
THEN the schedule will jump to tomorrow's schedule
THEN the schedule will jump back to today's schedule
AND the first asset displayed is the current On Now asset

title: Today: Verify selecting Today only displays today's schedule
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed the WWE Network
AND we have accessed the Channel
AND we navigated to the Schedule Section
custom_steps: WHEN we select the Today schedule option
custom_expected:
THEN only today's schedule will display, beginning with the most recent 'Live' asset (no archives will display)
AND traversing down today's scheduled programs will come to an end (will not continue to the next day)

title: Tomorrow: Verify selecting Tomorrow jumps to next calendar day schedule
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed the WWE Network
AND we have accessed the Channel
AND we navigated to the Schedule Section
custom_steps: WHEN we select the Tomorrow Schedule option
custom_expected: THEN the schedule will jump to the next calendar day

title: Tomorrow: Verify selecting the Tomorrow Schedule starts at 12AM of next calendar day
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed the WWE Network
AND we have accessed the Channel
AND we have navigated to the Schedule Section
custom_steps:
WHEN we select the Tomorrow schedule option
AND we look at the list of upcoming shows
custom_expected:
THEN the Programming Guide will begin at 12 AM of the calendar day

(or closely there after, depending on when the last program of the previous day ends)

title: Tomorrow: Verify navigation control works in both directions
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed the WWE Network
AND we have accessed the Channel
AND we navigate to Tomorrow's schedule
custom_steps:
WHEN we move the cursor to the day's programming
AND we scroll Down
AND we scroll Up
custom_expected:
THEN we will be able to navigate in both directions
AND we will be able to view the entire day's worth of content

title: Search: Verify the Search menu header highlights
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed the WWE Network
AND we have accessed the Channel
custom_steps: WHEN we navigate to the Search menu header
custom_expected:
THEN the menu header will show a white border around the white SEARCH menu text
AND in selecting the menu option, the white border disappears and the SEARCH menu text turns red

title: Search: Verify selecting Search menu opens the Search Page
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed the WWE Network
AND we have accessed the Channel
custom_steps: WHEN we navigate to and select the Search menu option
custom_expected: THEN the section contents update with Search functions

title: Search: Verify the Search user interface
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed the WWE Network
AND we have accessed the Channel
custom_steps:
WHEN we select the Search menu header
AND we observe the UI of the page
custom_expected:
THEN we see a search bar (in focus)
AND in the search bar is the ghost text "Search: Superstars, Show Names"
AND the default device keyboard displays

title: Search: Verify Left Trigger allows user to switch between regular/special characters
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed the WWE Network
AND we have accessed the Channel
AND we access the Search menu
custom_steps: WHEN we press the Controller's "Left Trigger"
custom_expected:
THEN the keyboard character menu will update
AND will alternate to Numbers/Special Characters
AND pressing Left Trigger again will alternate back to the Alphabet Characters

title: Results: Verify results auto-populate as search characters are entered
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed the WWE Network
AND we have accessed the Channel
AND we access the Search menu
custom_steps: WHEN we enter a valid characters string into the search bar (slowly)
custom_expected: THEN as characters are entered, the search results begin to auto-populate

title: Results: Verify searched character string displays milestone results
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed the WWE Network
AND we have accessed the Channel
AND we access the Search menu
custom_steps:
WHEN we enter a string of valid characters into the search bar
AND we select the searched term provided by the system
custom_expected: THEN milestone assets will appear in a grid view

title: Search: Verify returned results match metadata tags
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed the WWE Network
AND we have accessed the Channel
AND we have navigated to the Search menu
custom_steps:
WHEN we enter some search criteria
AND the results are returned
THEN we select the searched term/keyword
AND we access milestone tile grid
custom_expected:
THEN the milestone's details will (ordinarily) include the tag of the searched term within the description

NOTE:  there are times when the tag will NOT be displayed even though the searched term is represented in the video so you may need to search
Example:  searching for a specific wrestler but some results are of other matches, however seeking around the video yields the searched wrestler

title: Results: Verify Multiple Results Can Be Scrolled Through
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed the WWE Network
AND we have accessed the Channel
AND we access the Search menu
custom_steps: WHEN "Royal Rumble" is entered into the Search field
custom_expected: THEN the user can scroll through multiple Royal Rumble auto-complete suggestions

title: Results: Freeform Queries (No Keyword Match) Can Be Searched
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed the WWE Network
AND we have accessed the Channel
AND we access the Search section
custom_steps:
WHEN the user inputs "Cena vs Rock" into the Search Field
AND submits query (even though the term doesn't match directly against a keyword)
custom_expected: THEN the user should be presented with a list of directly related search results

title: My Account: Verify the My Account menu header highlights
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed the WWE Network
AND we have accessed the Channel
AND we are signed into a valid account
AND we navigate to the My Account section
custom_steps: WHEN we navigate to the My Account menu header
custom_expected:
THEN the menu header will show a white border around the white MY ACCOUNT menu text
AND selecting the menu option will show a white border around a now red MY ACCOUNT menu text

title: My Account: Verify selecting My Account opens the My Account Page
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed the WWE Network
AND we have accessed the Channel
AND we are signed into a valid account
AND we navigate to the My Account section
custom_steps: WHEN we select the My Account section
custom_expected: THEN the section contents update to My Account's user interface

title: My Account: Verify order of tiles
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed the WWE Network
AND we have accessed the Channel
AND we are signed into a valid account
AND we navigate to the My Account section
custom_steps: THEN we see the following order of tiles horizontally
custom_expected:
Watchlist
Continue Watching
Parental Controls
Log Out

title: Verify default Continue Watching tile image displays properly
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed the WWE Network
AND we have accessed the Channel
AND we are signed into a valid account
AND the account should not have any bookmarked assets
custom_steps:
WHEN we navigate into the My Account menu
AND we observe the Continue Watching tile
custom_expected: THEN it should display a default 'WWE' logo on a black background

title: Verify Continue Watching with no assets displays proper messaging
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed the WWE Network
AND we have accessed the Channel
AND we are signed into a valid account
AND the account should not have any bookmarked content
custom_steps:
Navigate to the My Account section
Select the Continue Watching tile
custom_expected:
A message is displays stating the following:

NO ITEMS YET

If you watch part of a video, it will be added here so you can watch
the rest.  If you don't see expected content, check your Parental
Control settings at wwe.com/pin and try again.

title: Verify Show Launch page for the bookmarked VOD displays proper action buttons
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed the WWE Network
AND we have accessed the Channel
AND we are signed into a valid account
AND we are on any show's launch page of a program not previously viewed
custom_steps:
1. Launch video via Watch Now
2. Let play for >15 secs
3. Back out of video
4. Select the program once again
custom_expected:
Show Launch page no longer displays Watch Now
Displays a Resume Watching button and 
Displays a Watch from Beginning button

title: Verify selecting Continue Watching opens the Continue Watching page
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed the WWE Network
AND we have accessed the Channel
AND we are signed into a valid account
AND we navigate to the My Account section
custom_steps:
1. Navigate to MY ACCOUNT menu header
2. Select the CONTINUE WATCHING tile
custom_expected:
THEN the Continue Watching page opens appropriately

NOTE: the contents within will show either:

a. If no videos have been partially watched, a "No items yet" message displays
b. If one or more videos have been bookmarked, a list grid displays

For each listed asset, the following displays (if available from data): 

> Thumbnail image
> Progress bar
> Show Title
> Episode Name
> Air Date

title: Verify launching a VOD and exiting playback before the end adds the content to the Continue Watching List
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed the WWE Network
AND we have accessed the Channel
AND we are signed into a valid account
custom_steps:
1. Go to the Shows menu
2. Select ONE show from each of the categories (PPV, In-Ring, Originals, Collections, Vault) that has not been viewed before 
3. Select WATCH NOW
4. Let playback continue for at least 15 seconds
5. Note the show and progress
5. Back out of video
7. Go to MY ACCOUNT and select CONTINUE WATCHING
custom_expected: THEN the video(s) launched and viewed in step 3 displays in the CONTINUE WATCHING list.

title: Verify selecting a tile from the Continue Watching list opens the Show Launch page for the VOD
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed the WWE Network
AND we have accessed the Channel
AND we are signed into a valid account
AND a video has been partially played and is added to the Continue Watching List
AND we navigate to the My Account section
custom_steps:
1. Select the CONTINUE WATCHING tile
2. Select any video asset from the list
custom_expected:
Show Launch page for the selected video opens and displays:

LEFT:
Thumbnail Image

RIGHT:
Show Name
Show Title
Date, TV-Rating
Description

Resume Watching button
Watch from Beginning button
Add/Remove Episode from Watchlist
Add/Remove Series from Watchlist (if applicable)

title: Verify partially viewed VOD assets display an accurately reflective progress bar
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed the WWE Network
AND we have accessed the Channel
AND we are signed into a valid account
custom_steps:
1. Navigate to a show on the home, shows or schedule pages
2. Launch and play or seek to a random time within the video and allow to play for >15 seconds
3. Note playback position in Video Playhead and exit playback from Video Program. 
4. Access the Continue Watching section
custom_expected: Progress bar is showing the expected (approximate) timeframe of previous playback (in red)

title: Verify launching content from the Continue Watching list, playback resumes at last known location
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed the WWE Network
AND we have accessed the Channel
AND we are signed into a valid account
AND assets (at least 2) have been added to the Continue Watching list
AND we have notated where the stopping point was within the assets
custom_steps:
1. Navigate to the My Account section
2. Select the CONTINUE WATCHING tile
3. Select a video previously played
4. Select RESUME WATCHING
custom_expected: Video playback resumes at last known position.

title: Verify launching content from the Continue Watching list, playback resumes; bypassing ads and bumpers
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed the WWE Network
AND we have accessed the Channel
AND we are signed into a valid account
AND assets (at least 2) have been added to the Continue Watching list
custom_steps:
Navigate to the My Account section
Select the CONTINUE WATCHING tile
Select a video previously played
Select RESUME WATCHING
custom_expected: Video playback resumes with no pre-rolls, ads or bumpers

title: Verify after launching content from the Continue Watching list, finishing program removes it from list
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed the WWE Network
AND we have accessed the Channel
AND we are signed into a valid account
AND one asset from each show category has been added to the Continue Watching list
custom_steps:
1. Navigate to the My Account section
2. Select the CONTINUE WATCHING tile
3. Select a video previously played
4. Select RESUME WATCHING
5. Seek forward to within the last minute (or so)
6. Allow video to play out to end
7. Back out to the Continue Watching screen
custom_expected:
Show is no longer in the Continue Watching list

(Do this for each asset added from each show category)

title: Verify app allows only one Bookmark per Video Program
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed the WWE Network
AND we have accessed the Channel
AND we are signed into a valid account
custom_steps:
1. Start at a Show Launch page of a program not yet viewed (no bookmark set)
2. Activate Watch Now button to launch video
3. Seek to 1/4 mark of progress bar, allow >10 sec. playback and note time point in program as seen in playhead
4. Back out of video
5. Navigate to Continue Watching and find the asset
6. Activate Resume Watching (Verify Expected Result) 
7. Rewind >3 minutes allow >10 sec. playback and note time point in program as seen in playhead
8. Back out of video
9. Access the program again
10. Activate Resume Watching (Verify Expected Result again)
custom_expected:
Verify correct progress bar positioning seen in playhead
Verify only one instance of the asset exists in the Continue Watching section

title: Verify partially watched Milestones are added to Continue Watching
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed the WWE Network
AND we have accessed the Channel
AND we are signed into a valid account
custom_steps:
1. Access the Search menu and search for a valid keyword or wrestler name
2. Select the keyword or name 
3. Choose any milestone video from within the video results grid
4. Select to "Watch Milestone"
5. Allow milestone to playback for >10 seconds
5. Stop video playback
6. Navigate to the Continue Watching section
custom_expected:
The episode that the milestone came from should appear in the Continue Watching list
The progress bar should reflect the approximate timeframe the video was exited

title: Verify Unaired Program "Network Interstitials" (Not Yet Aired content) is not added to Continue Watching when viewed
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed the WWE Network
AND we have accessed the Channel
AND we are signed into a valid account
custom_steps:
1. Go to Schedule
2. Access a program on the Schedule that has not yet aired (check listings here: http://network.wwe.com/)
3. Activate Watch Now and play the asset 
4. 15-20 seconds through the "This video is not yet available for on-demand viewing" reel, exit playback
5. Go to My Account
6. Access 'Continue Watching' and observe
custom_expected: The Network Interstitial tile should not populate this list

title: Verify reasonable number of items are added to the Continue watching list
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed the WWE Network
AND we have accessed the Channel
AND we are signed into a valid account
custom_steps:
1. Navigate around the Shows and Search pages and partially watch several episodes and milestones
2. Notate all the episodes and milestones watched
3. Navigate to My Account and access the Continue Watching tile

NOTE: "Several" is subjective, but ideally adding 3-5 assets per Show category and 3-5 milestones via Search should be sufficient.
custom_expected: All partially watched assets should be added and appear in the Continue Watching section

title: Verify Bookmarks are consistent and accessible on all devices
custom_preconds:
The Xbox One and a secondary platform must be used in this test

- XBox One is on any show's launch screen of an unseen program
- Other device is on any page other than Home
- Both devices are logged into same account
custom_steps:
1. On XBox One device, launch an asset not previously viewed
2. Seek >5 mins, allow to play for >10 seconds
3. Note time and exit via Back button
4. On the secondary device, navigate to Continue Watching and locate the recently viewed asset
5. Confirm 2nd device plays back same program from step 1 and from time noted in step 3
7. Seek >5 mins, allow to play for >10 seconds
8. Note time and exit via Back button
9. On XBox One, activate the asset and Resume Watching
10. Confirm XBox One plays back same program from step 1 and from time noted in step 8
custom_expected: Bookmarks will are synced across devices (+/- 10-15 seconds)

title: Verify after bookmark deletion - Resume Watching does not occur
custom_preconds:
With the user is logged into both the Xbox One app and the WWE website http://network.wwe.com/ with the same account.
There is at least one previously viewed asset in the Continue Watching list
Both the device and website are on the Continue Watching page
custom_steps:
1. Confirm the asset appears on both the device and website Continue Watching lists
2. Delete the asset from the http://network.wwe.com/activity (desktop website)
3. Activate the freshly deleted asset on the Xbox One
custom_expected:
App should jump to Show Launch page. 
Show launch page should appear as if never watched 
(Watch Now only, no Resume Watching)

title: Verify default Watchlist tile image displays properly
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed the WWE Network
AND we have accessed the Channel
AND we are signed into a valid account
AND the account should not have Watchlist items set
custom_steps:
WHEN we navigate into the My Account menu
AND we observe the Watchlist tile
custom_expected: THEN it should display a default 'WWE' logo on a black background

title: Verify a Watchlist with no assets displays proper messaging
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed the WWE Network
AND we have accessed the Channel
AND we are signed into a valid account
AND the account should not have Watchlist items set
custom_steps:
Navigate to the My Account section
Select the Watchlist tile
custom_expected:
A message is displays stating the following:

NO ITEMS YET

Here you can view episodes and series you have added to your
Watchlist.  If you don't see expected content, check your Parental
Control settings at wwe.com/pin and try again.

title: Verify episodes are added to the Watchlist
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed the WWE Network
AND we have accessed the Channel
AND we are signed into a valid account
custom_steps:
Navigate to any show and select a random episode from within its list
Select the 'Add Episode to Watchlist' button
Navigate to the Watchlist tile
custom_expected: Episode should appear in the Watchlist

title: Verify series' are added to the Watchlist
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed the WWE Network
AND we have accessed the Channel
AND we are signed into a valid account
custom_steps:
Navigate and activate any show on the Shows page
Select the 'Add Series to Watchlist' button
Navigate to the Watchlist tile
custom_expected: Series should appear in the Watchlist

title: Verify milestones are added to the Watchlist
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed the WWE Network
AND we have accessed the Channel
AND we are signed into a valid account
custom_steps:
Access the Search menu and search for a valid keyword or wrestler name
Select the keyword or name
Choose any milestone video from within the video results grid
Select to "Add Milestone to Watchlist"
custom_expected: Milestone should appear in the Watchlist

title: Verify reasonable number of items are added to the Watchlist
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed the WWE Network
AND we have accessed the Channel
AND we are signed into a valid account
custom_steps:
1. Navigate around the Shows and Search pages and add several episodes, series' and milestones
2. Notate all the episodes, series' and milestones added
3. Navigate to My Account and access the Watchlist tile

NOTE: "Several" is subjective, but ideally adding 3-5 assets per Show category and 3-5 milestones via Search should be sufficient.
custom_expected: All assets selected to be added to the Watchlist should appear in the Watchlist section

title: Verify Watchlist assets are consistent across connected devices
custom_preconds:
Must have current app installed on Xbox One and an alternate platform/device. 
Test account should not have Watchlist items set.
Both devices are logged into the same account.
custom_steps:
1. From any show launch page, add an episode and a series to the Watchlist
2. Navigate to the Search menu and search for a keyword or wrestler's name.
4. Choose a milestone and add to Watchlist.
5. Navigate to My Account > Watchlist
6. Confirm that expected items have been added
7. Quit application
8. Launch app on alternate device/platform
9. Navigate to the Watchlist and confirm that the assets within match accurately
10. Remove all watchlist items and confirm empty
11. Repeat steps vice versa with the alternate device
custom_expected: Regardless of adding or removing content, the list of assets within the Watchlist should always match between devices

title: Verify Watchlist assets are consistent across to the website
custom_preconds:
Must have current app installed on Xbox One and the web version http://network.wwe.com/
Test account should not have any Watchlist items set
Both devices are logged into the same account
custom_steps:
1. From any show launch page, add an episode and a series to the Watchlist
2. Navigate to the Search menu and search for a keyword or wrestler's name.
4. Choose a milestone and add to Watchlist.
5. Navigate to My Account > Watchlist
6. Confirm that expected items have been added
7. Quit application
8. Launch app on web browser http://network.wwe.com/
9. Navigate to the Watchlist and confirm that the assets within match accurately
10. Remove all watchlist items and confirm empty
11. Repeat steps vice versa with the web browser
custom_expected: Regardless of adding or removing content, the list of assets within the Watchlist should always match between the device and web

title: Verify Watchlist order is consistent across connected devices
custom_preconds:
Must have current app installed on Xbox One and an alternate platform/device. 
Test account should not have Watchlist items set.
Both devices are logged into the same account.
custom_steps:
1. Add several Episodes, Milestones and Series' to Watchlist
2. Navigate to My Account > Watchlist
3. Confirm that all expected items have been added and appear in order of most recent first
4. Note the order of the assets in the Watchlist
6. Launch app on the alternate platform/device
7. Confirm the order of the assets in the watchlist matches that of the UWP app
8. Remove an episode, series or milestone from the mid-list or end of list
9. Manually add the episode, series or milestone that was removed
9. Go back to the UWP watchlist and exit out
10. Relaunch the watchlist
custom_expected:
The removals/additions made on the website should reflect on the UWP version
The removals/additions made on the UWP version should reflect on the alternate platform/device

title: Verify Watchlist order is consistent across to the website
custom_preconds:
Must have current app installed on Xbox One and the web version http://network.wwe.com/
Test account should not have Watchlist items set.
Both devices are logged into the same account.
custom_steps:
1. Add several Episodes, Milestones and Series' to Watchlist
2. Navigate to My Account > Watchlist
3. Confirm that all expected items have been added and appear in order of most recent first
4. Note the order of the assets in the Watchlist
6. Launch app on web browser version
7. Confirm the order of the assets in the watchlist matches that of the UWP app
8. Remove an episode, series or milestone from the mid-list or end of list
9. Manually add the episode, series or milestone that was removed
9. Go back to the UWP watchlist and exit out
10. Relaunch the watchlist

(Try also making changes within the UWP app and verifying on the website)
custom_expected:
The removals/additions made on the website should reflect on the UWP version
The removals/additions made on the UWP version should reflect on the website

title: Verify episodes are removed from the Watchlist
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed the WWE Network
AND we have accessed the Channel
AND we are signed into a valid account
AND we have an episode saved to the Watchlist
custom_steps:
Navigate to the Watchlist and access the saved Episode
Select the button to "Remove Episode from Watchlist"
Select the BACK button
custom_expected: Episode has been removed from the Watchlist

title: Verify series' are removed from the Watchlist
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed the WWE Network
AND we have accessed the Channel
AND we are signed into a valid account
AND we have a series saved to the Watchlist
custom_steps:
Navigate to the Watchlist and access the saved Series
Select the button to "Remove Series from Watchlist"
Select the BACK button
custom_expected: Series has been removed from the Watchlist

title: Verify milestones are removed from the Watchlist
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed the WWE Network
AND we have accessed the Channel
AND we are signed into a valid account
AND we have a milestone saved to the Watchlist
custom_steps:
Navigate to the Watchlist and access the saved Milestone
Select the button to "Remove Milestone from Watchlist"
Select the BACK button
custom_expected: Milestone has been removed from the Watchlist

title: Verify enabling parental controls will hide (yet preserve) restricted Series content from user’s Watchlist
custom_preconds:
Test account should be set with parental controls OFF
Watchlist should be populated with at least one TV-14 or higher rated series
custom_steps:
1. Confirm TV-14 or higher series appears in Watchlist (eg. Total Divas, Camp WWE or Monday Night War)
2. Quit app.
3. Through user account (via WWE Network site) change account to "Parental Controls ON" and save settings.
4. Relaunch XB1.
5. Nav to Watchlist and confirm TV-14 or higher series items do not appear.
6. Quit app.
7. Through user account (via WWE Network site) change account to "Parental Controls OFF" and save settings.
8. Relaunch XB1.
9. Nav to Watchlist and confirm TV-14 or higher series items appear as expected as seen in step 1.
custom_expected:
Enabling parental controls will hide restricted content from user’s Watchlist and disabling parental controls will reveal the hidden content.

NOTE: Some series' will have episodes with varying content ratings within the series. In these cases, whole Series should not be hidden.

title: Verify enabling parental controls will hide (yet preserve) restricted Episodic content from user’s Watchlist
custom_preconds:
Test account should be set with parental controls OFF
Watchlist should be populated with at least one TV-14 or higher rated episode
custom_steps:
Confirm TV-14 or higher episodes appears in Watchlist (eg. from Total Divas, Camp WWE or Monday Night War)
Quit app.
Through user account (via WWE Network site) change account to "Parental Controls ON" and save settings.
Relaunch XB1.
Nav to Watchlist and confirm TV-14 or higher episode items do not appear.
Quit app.
Through user account (via WWE Network site) change account to "Parental Controls OFF" and save settings.
Relaunch XB1.
Nav to Watchlist and confirm TV-14 or higher episode items appear as expected as seen in step 1.
custom_expected: Enabling parental controls will hide restricted content from user’s Watchlist and disabling parental controls will reveal the hidden content.

title: Verify: Choosing Logout options successfully logs the user out of their account
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed the WWE Network
AND we have successfully logged in with a WWE account
custom_steps:
WHEN navigate to the My Account section
and we select the Log Out tile
custom_expected:
THEN we will be successfully logged out of our WWE account
AND we will be returned to the HOME page

title: Verify: Once logged out, previously accessible paid content can no longer be accessed
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed the WWE Network
AND we have successfully logged in with a WWE account
custom_steps:
WHEN navigate to the My Account section
and we select the Log Out tile
custom_expected:
THEN we will be logged out of the WWE Network
AND we will be unable to further access any paid WWE Network content that we could previously access

title: Verify: Verify if the user's profile access rights update that these are reflected in the Channel's viewable content
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed the WWE Network
AND we have successfully logged in with a WWE account
custom_steps: WHEN the accounts' access rights/parental restrictions are updated on the WWE website
custom_expected:
THEN the changes will be reflected in the application
AND the newly restricted content will be hidden/removed
OR the newly unrestricted content will now be available

REPEAT for both circumstances

title: Verify: Confirm that logging out as one user and logging in as another access rights behave accordingly (unrestricted to restricted)
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed the WWE Network
AND we have successfully logged in with a WWE account
AND the account has no parental restrictions
custom_steps:
WHEN navigate to the My Profile section
AND we select Log Out
AND we login with an account that has parental restrictions
custom_expected:
THEN the new user will be unable to view the previously unrestricted content
AND the content will be hidden accordingly

title: Verify: Confirm that logging out as one user and logging in as another access rights behave accordingly (restricted to unrestricted)
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed the WWE Network
AND we have successfully logged in with a WWE account
AND the account has parental restrictions
custom_steps:
WHEN navigate to the My Profile section
AND we select Log Out
AND we login with an account that has NO parental restrictions
custom_expected:
THEN the new user will be able to view the previously restricted content
AND the content will have no access right issues

title: Verify: Single Sign on Violation
custom_preconds:
NOTE:  You must have the xBox One and 5 additional devices at your disposal

GIVEN the WWE Network is already installed on all the devices
AND each device has the application launched
AND none of the devices are logged in
custom_steps:
WHEN we login to each 'additional' device with the same credentials 
AND begin launching videos to play concurrently (5 devices)
THEN we login and attempt to play a video from our main testing device as the 6th device overall
custom_expected:
THEN the user will receive a Single Sign On violation

The messaging will state:

"ERROR - Sign-on restriction.  Too many usage attempts"

AND the account will be locked
AND the user will be unable to login to any further accounts until this lock out has expired

title: Play: Verify user is able to play LIVE video over a wired connection
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have the XBox connected to a wired network connection
AND we have installed the WWE Network
AND we have accessed the Channel
custom_steps:
WHEN we locate a LIVE video feed
AND we attempt to play this
custom_expected:
THEN the video stream will launch successfully
AND the feed will play without issue

title: Play: Verify user is able to play VOD video over a wired connection
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have the XBox connected to a wired network connection
AND we have installed the WWE Network
AND we have accessed the Channel
custom_steps:
WHEN we locate a Video On Demand (archive) video feed
AND we attempt to play this
custom_expected:
THEN the video stream will launch successfully
AND the feed will play without issue

title: Play: Verify video playback launches in full screen
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have the XBox connected to a wired network connection
AND we have installed the WWE Network
AND we have accessed the Channel
custom_steps:
WHEN we locate a LIVE video feed
AND we attempt to play this
custom_expected:
THEN the video playback will launch
AND the playback will be full screen

title: Play: Verify that linear playback can continue for up to 2 hours without issue
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed the WWE Network
AND we have accessed the Channel
AND there is a LIVE event
custom_steps:
WHEN we attempt to Play the event
AND we receive the Playback Option prompt
AND we select "Live"
AND we stay in the Linear stream for at least 2 hours
custom_expected:
THEN playback will continue as expected
AND the user will not be kicked out of the stream

title: Play: User chooses "Beginning" from Playback Option Prompt
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed the WWE Network
AND we have accessed the Channel
AND there is a LIVE event
custom_steps:
WHEN we attempt to Play the event
AND we receive the Playback Option prompt
AND we select "Beginning"
custom_expected:
THEN the video playback will start
AND the location will be at the beginning
AND when the feed reaches the end the user will be returned to their original access point

**User will have been put into the NON-LINEAR feed by choosing Beginning**

title: Play: User chooses "Live" from Playback Option Prompt
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed the WWE Network
AND we have accessed the Channel
AND there is a LIVE event
custom_steps:
WHEN we attempt to Play the event
AND we receive the Playback Option prompt
AND we select "Live"
custom_expected:
THEN the video playback will start
AND the location will be at the current LIVE location
AND when the feed reaches the end the user will continue into the next scheduled show

**User will have been placed into the Linear feed by choosing Live**

title: CC: Verify toggle of Closed Captioning "On"
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed the WWE Network
AND we have accessed the Channel
AND we have launched a random VOD asset
AND the captioning is currently turned off
custom_steps:
WHEN we display the player controls
WHEN we select the 'CC' icon
custom_expected: THEN the closed captioning icon will turn RED (on)

title: CC: Verify toggle of Closed Captioning "Off"
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed the WWE Network
AND we have accessed the Channel
AND we have launched a random VOD asset
AND the captioning is currently turned on
custom_steps:
WHEN we display the player controls
AND we select the 'CC' icon
custom_expected: THEN the closed captioning icon will turn WHITE (off)

title: CC: Verify that Closed Captioning is available and functions for live streams
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed the WWE Network
AND we have accessed the Channel
AND we have navigated to the Home OR Schedule menu
custom_steps:
WHEN we launch the 'On Now' live/linear asset
AND allow the video playback via Watch Now
AND after any pre-rolls, we display the video controls
AND navigate to the right of the scrub bar
AND select the 'CC' icon
custom_expected:
THEN the 'CC' icon will change from white to highlight in red
AND selecting the icon will display closed caption text on screen
AND the 'CC' icon will remain red

title: CC: Verify that Closed Captioning is available for Video on Demand streams
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed the WWE Network
AND we have accessed the Channel
AND we have navigated to the Home, Shows or Schedule menu
custom_steps:
WHEN we launch a random VOD asset
AND allow the video playback via Watch Now
AND after any pre-rolls, we display the video controls
AND navigate to the right of the scrub bar
AND select the 'CC' icon
custom_expected:
THEN the 'CC' icon will change from white to highlight in red
AND selecting the icon will display closed caption text on screen
AND the 'CC' icon will remain red

title: CC: Verify that the ON setting is retained
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed the WWE Network
AND we have accessed the Channel
AND we have launched a random VOD asset
AND the captioning is currently turned off
custom_steps:
WHEN we turn on Closed Captioning
AND we confirm caption text on screen
AND we exit the video
AND we launch a different video
custom_expected:
THEN the closed caption setting should remain on (red highlight)
AND text is displayed on screen

title: CC: Verify that the OFF setting is retained
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed the WWE Network
AND we have accessed the Channel
AND we have launched a random VOD asset
AND the captioning is currently turned on
custom_steps:
WHEN we turn off Closed Captioning
AND we confirm no caption text on screen
AND we exit the video
AND we launch a different video
custom_expected:
THEN the closed caption setting should remain off (white text)
AND no text is displayed on screen

title: Verify Player controls appear for approximately 5 seconds after button(s) pressed
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed the WWE Network
AND we have accessed the Channel
custom_steps:
WHEN we launch a video feed
AND we tap either the [A] button or any direction on the D-Pad
custom_expected:
THEN the player controls overlay the bottom of the video
AND after approximately 5 seconds they disappear

title: Verify Player Controls function as expected
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed the WWE Network
AND we have accessed the Channel
custom_steps:
WHEN we launch a video feed (allowing pre-roll and TV-rating reels to finish)
AND we tap the [A] button
AND the Player Control overlay appears
AND the we attempt using the displayed controls
custom_expected:
THEN the controls will function as displayed:

In play mode, you should be able to select the pause icon and it will pause
In pause mode, you should be able to select the play icon and it will play
Selecting the left arrows should track back in 10 second intervals
Selecting the right arrows should seek forward in 30 second intervals

title: Verify incremental Rewind speed
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed the WWE Network
AND we have accessed the Channel
custom_steps:
WHEN we enter a video stream
AND we attempt to Rewind
AND we press the REW control multiple times
custom_expected: THEN the REW speed should increment accordingly

title: Verify incremental Fast Forward speed
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed the WWE Network
AND we have accessed the Channel
custom_steps:
WHEN we enter a video stream
AND we attempt to Rewind
AND we press the FF control multiple times
custom_expected: THEN the FF speed should increment accordingly

title: Verify Milestone Markers display
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed the WWE Network
AND we have accessed the Channel
AND we are signed in with a valid WWE account
AND we navigate to the Shows page
custom_steps:
WHEN we select a VOD that contains wrestling matches
AND we press DOWN on the D-pad
custom_expected:
THEN the player controls appear
AND red and white milestone markers appear along the video scrub bar

title: Verify the ability to traverse through markers
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed the WWE Network
AND we have accessed the Channel
AND we are signed in with a valid WWE account
AND we navigate to the Shows page
custom_steps:
WHEN we select a VOD that contains wrestling matches
AND we press [ R1 ] on the controller multiple times
AND we press [ L1 ] on the controller multiple times
custom_expected:
THEN an overlay with an arrow will appear and hover over each marker
AND all the [ R1 ] presses jump right to each marker
AND all the [ L1 ] presses jump left to each marker
AND when traversing right and left, no markers are skipped

title: Verify image and metadata display with markers in focus
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed the WWE Network
AND we have accessed the Channel
AND we are signed in with a valid WWE account
AND we navigate to the Shows page
custom_steps:
WHEN we select a VOD that contains wrestling matches
AND we traverse through the milestone markers

title: Verify proper behavior of milestone marker activation
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed the WWE Network
AND we have accessed the Channel
AND we are signed in with a valid WWE account
AND we navigate to the Shows page
custom_steps:
WHEN we select a VOD that contains wrestling matches
AND we traverse through the milestone markers
AND we activate milestone markers at random
custom_expected:
THEN the video will jump to the marker selected
AND playback will commence from that spot

title: Verify player controls disappear within 5 seconds after marker activation
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed the WWE Network
AND we have accessed the Channel
AND we are signed in with a valid WWE account
AND we navigate to the Shows page
custom_steps:
WHEN we select a VOD that contains wrestling matches
AND we traverse through the milestone markers
AND we activate milestone markers at random
custom_expected:
THEN the video will jump to the marker selected
AND the video player controls disappear within 5 seconds of inactivity

title: Network: Verify bandwidth/stream quality adapts with network fluctuations
Network: Verify video quality improves with connectivity improvement
Network: Verify when throttling connection strength that bitrate playback adjusts without issue in both directions
Ads: Resuming playback of a bookmarked asset will not show Ads (or advisory slates)
Ads: On Now - Now (Linear stream) does not play ad
Ads: On Now - From Beginning (VOD) plays ad before content playback
Ads: On Now - From Beginning (Ghost event - live event) does not play ad before content playback
Ads: VOD (archived videos) - Ad plays before un-bookmarked video playback
Ads: Verify that the ability to seek is disabled during prerolls
PP: At the end of a VOD playback, the user is greeted with a post screen with either the next episode or live linear
PP: User is greeted with the next episode when watching an original series or a collection that isn't the latest episode.
PP: The Post-Play screen displays a "more episodes" button that, when accessed, will direct the user to the show's carousel
custom_preconds: This case only pertains to episodes that have a show associated with them.

title: PP: User should be able to return to the video asset detail page if said User presses the return button
Play: Verify user is able to play LIVE video over a wireless connection
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we are connected to a wireless network connection
AND we have installed the WWE Network
AND we have accessed the Channel
custom_steps:
WHEN we locate a LIVE video feed
AND we attempt to play this
custom_expected:
THEN the video stream will launch successfully
AND the feed will play without issue

(NOTE: Wireless is known to be unreliable and noted as so by Microsoft - Microsoft will not run this test in cert)

custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have are connected to a wireless network connection
AND we have installed the WWE Network
AND we have accessed the Channel
custom_steps:
WHEN we locate a Video On Demand (archive) video feed
AND we attempt to play this
custom_expected:
THEN the video stream will launch successfully
AND the feed will play without issue

(NOTE: Wireless is known to be unreliable and noted as so by Microsoft - Microsoft will not run this test in cert)
